column4: Volkswagen spends billions more on electric cars in search for mass market
column5: FRANKFURT Volkswagen  is stepping up its shift to electric cars and plans to invest more than 20 billion euros ($24 billion) in zero-emission vehicles by 2030 to challenge pioneer Tesla  in creating a mass market. | Video

column4: U.S. agency expected to find Tesla's Autopilot contributed to crash
column5: WASHINGTON The National Transportation Safety Board is expected to find on Tuesday that Tesla Inc's Autopilot system was a contributing factor in a May 2016 Model S crash that killed a  man in Florida while using the car's semi-autonomous driving system  two people briefed on the matter said.

column4: UPDATE 1-VW spends billions more on electric cars in search for mass market
column5: * VW to offer electric versions of all models no later than 2030

column4: Family of Tesla driver killed in 'Autopilot' crash does not blame car
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 11 The family of the driver of a Tesla Model S who was killed in a May 2016 crash while using the car's semi-autonomous driving system said on Monday the car was not to blame for the crash.

column4: Google challenges record EU antitrust fine in court
column5: BRUSSELS Google  appealed on Monday against a record 2.4-billion-euro ($2.9 billion) EU antitrust fine  with its chances of success boosted by Intel's  partial victory last week against another EU sanction.

column4: Google challenges record EU antitrust fine in court
